interbase.interclient
Class JdbcConnectionFactory

java.lang.Object
  interbase.interclient.DataSourceProperties
      interbase.interclient.JdbcConnectionFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.naming.Referenceable, javax.sql.ConnectionPoolDataSource, javax.sql.XADataSource
public class JdbcConnectionFactory
extends DataSourceProperties
implements javax.sql.ConnectionPoolDataSource, javax.sql.XADataSource, javax.naming.Referenceable

A ConnectionPoolDataSource object is a factory for PooledConnection objects. An object that implements this interface will typically be registered with a JNDI service.

Title: InterClient type 4

Description: Interface added to implement ConnectionPoolDataSource

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2002-2003

Company: Borland Software Corporation

Since:
JDBC 2 Standard Extension
Version:
4.0, Std Ext 0.7
Author:
Shaunak Mistry
See Also:
Serialized Form

 javax.naming.Reference getReference()
          This property controls how many "pooled" statements can be open at one time by a Connection created by this factory If the number of "used" plus "pooled" statements exceeds maxConStatements, pooled statements will be closed when the Connection attempts to move a used statement to the statement pool.

getXAConnection

public javax.sql.XAConnection getXAConnection(java.lang.String user,
                                              java.lang.String password)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
Returns a XAConnection to the JDataStore specified in the url property via the JDataStore JDBC driver (which must be specified in the driver property). XAConnections are only useful in conjunction with a distributed transaction manager, such as the one provided by the Inprise Application Server.

Specified by:
getXAConnection in interface javax.sql.XADataSource
Parameters:
user - String
password - String
Returns:
interbase.interclient.XAConnection
Throws:
interbase.interclient.SQLException
java.sql.SQLException

getReference

public javax.naming.Reference getReference()
                                    throws javax.naming.NamingException
This property controls how many "pooled" statements can be open at one time by a Connection created by this factory If the number of "used" plus "pooled" statements exceeds maxConStatements, pooled statements will be closed when the Connection attempts to move a used statement to the statement pool.

Specified by:
getReference in interface javax.naming.Referenceable
Throws:
javax.naming.NamingException
